intro: Rhexia alata, commonly known as the wingedleaf sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, winged leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Rhexia alata thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
